body_html:
Rekha-

Thanks much for your comment; now I at least have a clue where I should be looking.

I don't have gflags installed. I tried using an environment variable (which has been alleged to work in comments elsewhere), but it sadly did not work for me:

ub1% GLOG_minloglevel=3 python
Python 2.7.10 (v2.7.10:15c95b7d81dc, May 23 2015, 09:33:12)
[GCC 4.2.1 (Apple Inc. build 5666) (dot 3)] on darwin
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.

import tensorflow
tensorflow.Session()
I tensorflow/core/common_runtime/local_device.cc:40] Local device intra op parallelism threads: 4
I tensorflow/core/common_runtime/direct_session.cc:58] Direct session inter op parallelism threads: 4
<tensorflow.python.client.session.Session object at 0x10693fb50>
import os
os.environ['GLOG_minloglevel']
'3'

Any thoughts? I also tried setting os.environ['GLOG_minloglevel'] = '3' within python directly prior to importing tensorflow, also no luck there.

body:
Rekha-

Thanks much for your comment; now I at least have a clue where I should be looking.

I don't have gflags installed.  I tried using an environment variable (which has been alleged to work in comments elsewhere), but it sadly did not work for me:

ub1%  GLOG_minloglevel=3 python
Python 2.7.10 (v2.7.10:15c95b7d81dc, May 23 2015, 09:33:12) 
[GCC 4.2.1 (Apple Inc. build 5666) (dot 3)] on darwin
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.

> > > import tensorflow
> > > tensorflow.Session()
> > > I tensorflow/core/common_runtime/local_device.cc:40] Local device intra op parallelism threads: 4
> > > I tensorflow/core/common_runtime/direct_session.cc:58] Direct session inter op parallelism threads: 4
> > > <tensorflow.python.client.session.Session object at 0x10693fb50>
> > > import os
> > > os.environ['GLOG_minloglevel']
> > > '3'

Any thoughts?  I also tried setting os.environ['GLOG_minloglevel'] = '3' within python directly prior to importing tensorflow, also no luck there.
